place_description: Indulge in handcrafted pastries, cakes, and local coffee at Sunflour Baking Company in Dilworth. Savor breakfast and lunch dishes made from scratch, or grab something to go. They also cater events and weddings, bringing their delicious creations to your special occasion.

reviews_data.review_text: I try to come here and give this place another chance every year. They are consistently the SLOWEST. Not busy and takes FOREVER to get your food and then it comes out wrong.
Great bakery!  Grand kids love this place!  Nice to rat outside...

I came in at 3pm on a Saturday-- the place was almost empty, but it took 30 minutes to get my sandwich. I saw it sitting out and ready, but the lady working never brought it to me. After 5-10 minutes I eventually asked her to retrieve it. It was cold. Bad customer service, not great food. Good coffee and pastries though.

Good vibe, cute spot, good customer service. Food was bad. A 25 minute wait (and it wasn't busy - only one other person was in there) and $9 for an egg sandwich after tax + tip that was literally just... egg and bread. No spread, no seasoning, no cheese, no greens, no other toppings of any kind. Disappointing food experience for sure. Their coffee and other food options might be better, but considering they have the audacity to put something like that "egg sandwich" I tried on the menu and then charge $9 (after tax and tip) for it, I doubt I'll be coming back to find out.

Decided to stop in for a bite, the atmosphere  is delightful. But my chedder biscuit sandwich lacked chedder and was extremely hard. The peach blossom was goodish. I paid $15 and was disappointed. Better luck next time..
Worst Tiramisu I've ever had. The ladyfingers were not dipped in coffee at all and were actually so dry they were crunchy.

Exceptionally delicious! Having a long weekend in Uptown and visited on 3/15/24. The Morning Glory Muffins, festive green Sugar Cookie sandwiches, Pecan Cinnamon Rolls and Black & White cupcakes were amazing! The cold brew was bitter unfortunately. Highly recommend their bakes!
$10+ for avocado toast with 1/2 of an avocado, cut up and on top of a bed of arugula on a dry piece of sourdough and took 45 minutes. Bad experience

I was having a rough day and the cashier last Saturday treated me with such kindness and patience!! Like who wants to be sobbing while ordering breakfast? No one haha so being treated so well made me feel seen and normal.

The food was also really good - everyone at our table was raving about the cheddar biscuit!!

Will def return!

If you are considering a custom cake, this is your place! Absolute life savers! They made my wife's birthday the toast of the town with a customized birthday cake. Not only was it decorated to perfection with creativity, it was moist and delicious. Most of all, it was affordable! Other places I got quotes for 3-4 times the price for the same cake! I'd recommend this bakery for all occasions big and small!
They need to close down the place.The wait for one sandwich is ridiculous. The food is way over priced.l wilnt be returning.
30+ minute wait for a sandwich, extremely insincere service. Refuses concessions to customers with bad experiences.
Terrible experience from service person. She had a scowl on her face, never said thank you, and i will go elsewhere next time. Place was messy and counters full of previous customer's trash.
I had a BLT for lunch and this was the worst BLT sandwich I've ever had. If I didn't have to attend a meeting I would have taken it back. The sandwich didn't even have a taste to it really.
Ordered a number 4 and everything was a bit bland and the food doesn't taste very fresh. Most of the workers were nice with the exception of a few rude comments from one.
OMG, outstanding food, friendly atmosphere,just a little high. Everything is sperate!

We all enjoyed our food (blueberry muffin) and drinks (dark roast coffee and cappuccino). However the barista walked away in the middle of making the cappuccino, so five minutes later I had to go inquire after the drink. The cashier stepped in and made it for me.

Food was delicious, and lavender latte was perfect. Only one person working front, which was fine.  No problem waiting and she was very polite.   Cafe was dirty though, tables,  floor etc. Definitely made me not sit and stay even though there was plenty of spots to sit.
Love this place. Both locations are consistent with quality, and customer service. The coffee is always amazing and the food is FRESH. This is always a go to spot

Extremely, extremely slow. Waited 30 mins for a single breakfast sandwich as the only customer in the store and 3 employees visibly just standing around. Unfortunately, the food and location are great, otherwise it would be easy to not return. Go for something in pastry case if visiting.

Please don't steal my child's photo and use it to promote your store on social media.

If you want something from my family to promote Sunflour you can use this:  the last time we went to any of your locations we waited 30 minutes for our food because your staff somehow lost our ticket and were completely unapologetic about it.
We waited 30 minutes for the worst blt and bacon egg and cheese we've ever had. The bread was painfully dry. The girl at the counter was nice.

Nice little shop. Unfortunately there is a disconnect between running a smooth bakery/cafe and the staff employed. We ordered two sandwiches and a coffee (Sat 12/9, 1pm), and while the coffee was provided quickly, we waited over 20 mins for the sandwiches and every other person in the store was waiting as well. Only after I went to the cashier to ask for a status after providing very little response without a smile did she go back and about 3-4 orders were brought out between herself and 2-3 back kitchen staff. When the food arrived, it was tasty, though the bread was overly toasted/hard. Unfortunately we've had a similar experience at the Ballantyne location, and while I like the Midtown one, I can no longer go to Sunflower with my wife. We've been burned with a bad experience one too many times. Please coach staff to be more engaged, turn around food in a timely manner, and really focus on the customer experience. This is what hurt our visit more than anything.

After more than 40 minutes to get a single sandwich and being told it was being worked on, they finally told me they had lost my ticket and asked if I wanted a refund. 40 minutes for a 10 dollar sandwich is pretty ridiculous, and I consider 40 minutes of my time to be worth more than that. Disappointing.
Croissants are really good. The espresso was underwhelming

Its sad to see this locations assortment declining each week.  I go early Saturday morning and for the past three weeks or so they don't have their signature products available.  Bring back the cheddar biscuits to this location please!  The morning glory muffin would be nice to see as well.

I have loved sunflower for years but every time I go to the Dilworth location it is a cluster. The workers can't keep orders straight and I am always told 15 mins and it turns out to be 45. Please just tell me 45 if that is the reality. They lose orders and none of the staff seems to be trained or on the same page.

What I ate, was great, however their handicapped entrance leaves much to be desired. It is keyed for a security code you don't know - handicap people need a non-handicapped person to go in and come around to another door to open it and then open a second door in order to let you in. And, as I presume - the owner/manager license plate "SOURDOH!", was parked, without a handicap sticker or plate taking up both handicap slots behind the establishment! If that doesn't send a message about their attitude and customer service regarding handicapped individuals, I don't know what else will? It would also benefit their customers for them to have sugar-free coffee syrups, they have alternative sugar additives so why not the syrups?

Absolutely unacceptable experience. Waited 45 minutes for 2 cheddar biscuits only for them to come out stale and ice cold, not to mention several long brown hairs throughout the food. Staff was kind and refunded the meal, but disappointing to see a place that was once so great fall so far
Muffins are great and coffee is pretty good! I ordered a sandwich off the menu the other day and it came totally different than advertised. It was not good and I was bummed. Get the muffin instead

Delicious pastries but the Monday morning staff (at least one employee anyway) were very rude. I will probably go to a different location next time. Both my friend and I experienced very unfriendly behavior from staff. I suggest some customer service training.
Otherwise, good place for breakfast.

The crust of the key lime pie is, at times, a little thick, and I end up with more crust than filling.  But other than that, nice little bakery.  It'd be nice if customers were acknowledged a little sooner.  To acknowledge the person who just walked in, even if you're taking care of another customer, is always a good way to make them more comfortable waiting.  Then they don't just feel ignored while standing awkwardly for long periods of time.
Had a bacon egg and cheese on sourdough and a chocolate croissant. Both were superb.

Don't waste your time. This location is very dirty. Sanitation rating is an 88 posted but the floors, counters and chairs are covered in trash and crumbs with employees standing around. I don't know where the manager is but this place REALLY needs improvement. We waited over 35 minutes for just 1 sandwich.
Love their croissants! Always get the pistachio milk with coffee or matcha. Neighborhood fave of mine!

My work ordered the boxed lunches from Sunflour last week and it had to be the saddest meal/sandwich I have ever received from somewhere. I ordered the TAB sandwich, with chocolate chip cookie and side of fruit. The TAB sandwich had to be made the night before. The sandwich was cold, the avocado looked to be one piece/slice that was a mushed into the bread and completely brown. Nothing like what the website shows (see attached photo). Instead of a chocolate chip cookie, they gave me raisin and the "side of fruit" was a granny smith apple uncut.
Very good. We all wanted seconds.
Had a hot raspberry latte here and it was good. Would've loved to have something savory alongside the latte but they mostly had sweet items during my visit.
No gluten free options :((

Have wanted to try Sunflour forever! Finally made it in. Went around brunch on a Friday and there was plenty of parking out back and seating inside/out. Ordered the #6 Sunny's Special and a mocha iced latte. Everything was delicious.
The vanilla croissant rolls are excellent! This is a great bakery and cafe with excellent customer service.
Never again. Stale. Disappointing.
Great place for coffee and a quick bite. Relaxed quiet atmosphere. Perfect place to catch it with a friend!

Pros: Good location and easy to find on East Blvd. with indoor and outdoor seating. Assortment of pastries.

Cons: Ordered one breakfast sandwich (#2) and a chicken salad sandwich. Our wait time was 35 minutes. The chicken salad sandwich had old-hard bread (the bread is stale), and the breakfast sandwich had the spinach stems included.
Price for the two sandwiches was $17.00. Not worth the price!
Still remains my go to coffee shop/bakery. The points system is also amazing and you get free drinks or cookies pretty often. The staff is also always incredibly nice!
My order arrived almost an hour late and cold. I paid $6 for half a toast? Just a chunk of avocado on part of a toast?

It's a decent spot! I've had their coffee a few times and feel as though I have enough data to say it's not that great.

Their muffins are really good. Just not very impressed with their coffee. In a pinch Id still come here though.

But if you're looking for a treat of coffee, maybe try else where! No offense. Really great location. There's parking. seating inside. Very accommodating service.
Cute lunch spot, feels quaint despite being right outside of Southend. Good sandwiches and fun vibes. Also, have coffee and breakfast items. Will be going there to work soon
Only got the cheddar biscuit on a quick pop in, but the flavor was great, the outside was nicely crisped/crunchy, and the inside was soft and tender.

Took 25 minutes to get a sandwich with hardly any patrons inside the restaurant. Occasional people walking in for take out.The egg bacon and cheese sandwich which was like a hockey puck and so dry and tasteless. Moreover, I took a sip of coffee and It was so hot it burnt the roof of my mouth and now I have 2 pieces of skin hanging off the roof of my mouth. Take your own risk if you want to venture into this restaurant. I do not recommend.

I love sunflour! Their coffee is amazing, and their food is even better. I love their baked goods. My favorite thing to get is one of their sandwiches on a croissant. Their croissants are so buttery and flaky. Great atmosphere too!

I got a Black Friday sandwich on sourdough, quite good.  It was great as advertised, Turkey, Brie, and cranberry relish.  In my family we call it Thanksgiving on a bun and add a slice of dressing... makes a superior sandwich.  It was good, don't get me wrong, just not as good as my mom.  (:

We ordered a cake for my daughter's 1st wedding anniversary and even though the cake itself was delicious saying the decoration was bad would be a true understatement. On top of that, it was supposed to be $40 for the small cake and when we went to pick it up the price was $70. I cannot even make up how bad the decoration was so I posted the picture.  I showed my husband the picture of the cake that was shown to the bakery and he laughed and said Nailed It! At least we got a laugh out of it.

This location has high quality bread just like the one on 7th Street. I would recommend to let the bread cool before bagging or put it in a bag that can breathe. I would like the choice of half a loaf, because I like fresh bread.
I cannot eat a whole loaf in 3days.

Find this to be the best of the Sunflour locations in Charlotte. Parking is easy (private lot on side and back) and easy to access by foot or bike within the Dilworth neighborhood, too. They typically have 1-2 gluten-free pastry offerings -- though this is by no means a gluten-friendly establishment (ie the pastries are stored in the same case as regular items and the team doesn't change gloves to serve GF items), it is nice to have a location that has any option if you are grabbing a coffee out. Note this does get very crowded on weekend mornings and the wait is usually out the door so try to get there early.
I appreciate they have at least one GF option

Their food is sooo good! Sunflour baking has been a favorite place of ours to eat. No visit is complete without several baked goods to eat after our lunch and more to go home with us.
Update: we've been going to Sunflour weekly and this week they have streamlined things. If you are eating there(outside or inside), they will bring you your food instead of people congregating inside waiting. It was much nicer that way.
Not great, poor selection but did have nice staff

The service here is so terrible it's mind blowing. Waited 40 minutes for sandwiches, only to find out the order was never taken to the back (!?!). Our ticket was refunded but that hardly makes up for wasting nearly an hour and leaving with 2 hungry kids. The employees are rude, dismissive, and airheaded.
Ham & Gruyere is on point
Best pastries and sandwiches in town with awesome baristas!!
Rude service.  Complete chaos on a busy morning and multiple customers with food and drink errors.  Two stars because it has potential and a decent patio.

Ordered online on Friday at 7:28 a.m. for breakfast and some pastries for pick up. I was quoted via their online order site that my order would be ready for pick up at 7:58 a.m. When my husband went to pick up the order at 8 a.m., the order was still not ready and my husband watched them print out the order while he waited. It took another 15 min to get our meal. Not acceptable to have to wait for almost an hour to get one breakfast sandwich and a couple pastries (that didn't have to be prepared). Won't be coming back to this location.
I tried the berry croissant and the layers... the flakiness.. 10/10. The latte I had was delicious. I'll definitely be back!

Stopped by for two coffees. I was given my first order and had to remind them for the second. I noticed there was a scent coming from the inside that made me want to sit outside. I would come back again.
Their avocado melt is excellent.
Gluten free chocolate chip cookie and s'more cream puff was delicious! Great food and great people!
The BEST blueberry muffin I've had in a long time, and IT WAS WARM!!!

The cinnamon rolls I bought ( 1-2-20-23) were the worst one's I've ever tasted. I don't know what went wrong. Usually they are the best. It didn't taste like a cinnnamon roll. We had to throw them away.
Breakfast Sammys bang. Didn't try a coffee but going to next time. It gets really crowded in here and is pretty small so try to go not at peak hours
Cheddar biscuits were excellent. Amazing. Cute location. Good service. They have a parking lot. We were actively trying to find biscuits for our 2 day Charlotte trip

I visited the shop today 12/27 at 3:30 PM - so 30 min before closing. Ordered a drip coffee, chips, and a $10 sandwich. I was not asked what type of bread I wanted - but whatever. Then waited 15 min which was odd because there was no one else waiting. There was only 3 other customers sitting in the bakery having coffee. Now I will say I did not tip (it was togo and an overpriced sandwich plus it was drip coffee and she handed me a bag of chips). The 1 star is for the sandwich. I ordered the turkey, brie, and cranberry "spread" sandwich. It came out with a glob of spread in the center of sandwich, 1 slice of turkey and the brie only in the center of the sandwich. It was just awful! I can only assume it was because I did not tip. I need to remind myself to never order sandwiches and stick to coffee and bakery items.

Came here on a lovely sunday morning to try some coffee. Had a great time and sat outside. Comfortable seating and the staff even brought us our drinks. Nice place to meet with friends and have a chat. Good selection of food and beverges
Y'all are the best! Thanks so much for getting me some decaf coffee. First time ordering from here, new in the area. Food is delicious, and very friendly customer service!

The food and the manager saved this review. I had ordered two biscuits and two muffins pickup. When I arrived, one of the associates was having trouble finding my order because it had been taken/given to someone else....after the associate realized it was missing, instead of offering a refund or some kind of reparation, she asked if I wanted to take someone else's order...which was crazy to me. Of course I said no and asked for my food to be remade. I waited 15 minutes, hoping that when my order finally came out it would be accompanied with a remedy. No such balm came so I had to ask for a refund. The manager kindly issued a refund without hesitation, thankfully. This is my second time eating sunflower and the magic of the first experience was lost this time around. The food just isn't as good as I remember, but it's still one of the best biscuits I've had in the city. I would order again...ps: the menu says roasted tomatoes but my biscuit came with one lone tomato slice and I'm pretty sure I'm missing my pesto sauce...lol I just wish things went smoother.

I'm currently in the restaurant and so ready to leave. Its my second time here but this go round the cashier with glasses has got to be the rudest person! Such a nasty disposition. You can tell from the second I walked up she was annoyed. Good customer service goes a long way. She missed out on a tip because of her discussing attitude. On top of that the counter was so freaking dirty!!! Hair alllllll over the counter!!! Omg how nasty

Halfway through their open hours they're out of anything decent, more often than not; including popular items needed to make a sandwich, as well as bakery items.
Should not have to call ahead to purchase a sandwich, as well as most bakery items, and the weekend is worse.
Purchased a key lime pie - bland. Added a lot of lime juice to give it taste. Scone was terrible. Tried to eat, but tossed out most of it. How is it possible to mess up a scone?
Wasted time, fuel, and money.
Amazing food and probably one of the best customer experiences I've ever had. They were able to help with a custom gender reveal cupcake on the same day within minutes.
Never disappointed with the coffee here!! The staff and the seating outside the Cafe are amazing too!!

10/30/2022 - Over priced and nothing special! Been to this bakery several times and not sure what all the hype is about. Never believe reviews.
The pastries taste ok. Some I couldn't eat.
You can get better tasting pastries at walmart or harris teeter bakeries at less than half the price!

The Sunflour baking company is a staple here in Charlotte for amazing baked goods, My favorites are the vanilla sweet rolls and chocolate croissant! They are located near the intersection of South Blvd and East Blvd in Dilworth. The coffee is great too and always nice to be able to order and sit in the chill atmosphere. There is convenient parking in the back with easy access.

Great spot! We love sunflour for their selection of delicious coffees and breakfast bites. You'll almost never walk in to an empty room so be prepared to wait in line - trust me its worth it. I always like to try the seasonal coffees/lattes. Their pastries are yummy and breakfast sandwiches are solid!

Only reason I didn't give 5 stars is they take a long time to prepare food orders and their coffee cups leak from the bottom (please get higher quality cups!)
Sunflower is great. Its in an old house in the great Dilworth area. They have kind service, good food, and sufficient parking.

Obsessed with this bakery. The cheddar biscuits are so delicious but make sure to order early or they will sell out. The coffee is strong and tasty. I love their outdoor space and the staff is always extremely friendly. This place is packed on the weekends!

Have tried ordering pick up twice now. Both times very wrong order. My sandwich had only chicken and cheese (no bacon or jalapeno) and was on the wrong bread. And the first time the sandwich was closer but they didn't put my pastry in the bag. I advise not tipping on to go orders until u see that ur order is correct, then u can tip in cash.

Edit: I drove back for them to remake my sandwich. They still made it wrong.

We love Sunflower Baking! We frequent the spot in Harrisburg and wanted to check out this location! Inside seating is small but so cute. Plenty of outdoor seating for families with pups. The food is always delightful and the employees were working so hard to get to everyone (this place is def busy - may I suggest ordering ahead) taken care of! We would recommend to coffee drinkers and baker fans alike! Bathrooms here are disgusting tho... super gross... and it took 30 minutes for one sandwich.
Slowwwwwwwww

Really disappointed in the customer service. The restaurant was dirty. Walked in and was not even greeted for over 5 minutes. The young girl working had her back turned towards us and it was obvious that we were standing waiting to have our orders taken. Another young girl came out from the back and was also incredibly rude. Did not even ask what kind of chips I wanted just handed me a bag.

Sad because the food and coffee here is some of my favorite but I will not be returning to this location because of the poor customer service.

My first time ordering from here... so delicious! I got the cheddar biscuit breakfast sandwich and the Black Friday. Both SO good. Thank you Suzy for your help when there was a hiccup in the system -- just really thoughtful. Can't wait to try some other things, like the coffees and sweets, and sit outside.

Rarely take the time to review things, but the customer service here was terrible!! Went at noon over the weekend and there were 2 muffins left in the case. Ordered a muffin for the kids and two sandwiches for the adults. Had to remind them to give us the muffin after waiting for 10 minutes so they didn't sell it to someone else. After being reassured multiple times by the cashier that our sandwiches were being made, we left with a refund because he had never given the slip to the back and they ran out of bread!! Not sure how they expected to remian open for 4 more hours with absolutely no product. Staff was flippant, unapologetic and annoyed when we were upset we never got our food. Multiple other customers left after being told their food was being made when the slips were never brought to the back. A waste of an hour waiting for sandwiches they never intended to make. Won't be returning any time soon.

The food and coffee are good, but they are VERY slow and seem disorganized.  It took over 10 minutes to just get my coffee - just a decaf latte.  Granted it was a Sunday morning, but still...
Definitely not somewhere to go if you are in a rush.  Not even sure if the long wait is worth the end product.  My sandwich was good, but bacon was undercooked and there really wasn't much to the sandwich.  For what you pay at this place you definitely expect more.

We really liked Sunflour. The staff was attentive. It's a small shop and they do not serve bagels (Incase you were wondering like we were) but the coffee and pastries are awesome! We will definitely be back.

So I generally hate 3 star reviews and do not bother if it is just meh.  The reason for the 3 stars here - if they have it ready, this place is amazing.  We love the blueberry muffins.  However I like to go early to go with my coffee and far too often they do not have the baked goods ready.  Always disappointing to get there and hear "sorry, we do not have those, it will be an hour or two".
Nice staff and very happy they could accommodate the vegan carrot cake I ordered. Though, it was a bit bland. I still appreciate it
Good place to eat and enjoy
Aubrey was super helpful. Great staff and coffee

Just a terrific crew at this location. Always pleasant and courteous.  At this time they are offering Hot Cross Buns for the Easter season. In a word "WOW". Not to say that every offering isn't already delicious, but adding another winner to an already stacked deck is phenomenal.

Make sure you check out the new Summer Seasonal Delights That that they are serving up
Sunflour is a low-key quirky spot, perfect for a casual breakfast or brunch. Outdoor seating is available. The prices are very reasonable (something that's very surprising nowadays).
Poor service. Great food. Go to a different location
Almond croissant is a must try!

I came in around lunchtime and i was able to order as soon as I walked in the shop. I had an Iced Dirty Mocha and a grilled Chicken Caprese, both delicious! The blend of the flavors in the mocha tied in together nicely. The sourdough was soooo fresh and had a delicious crunch to it. Definitely looking forward to coming back here again.
really tasty and super friendly people. I'm partial to the cream-cheese danishes.
People that work there are racists it's 2022 no one cares for your hatred for brown skin or ethnic people I should be able to be to feel welcomed anywhere I'm spending my hard earned money.

The coffee was great and the staff helpful. This is not my favorite location, simply because of the size of the shop itself, the limited parking, and accessibility. Still, if you live within Charlotte, it is a great coffee shop.

I love coming to Sunflour when I'm in town, but this most recent trip with my mom was the best! We both got sandwiches, I got my usually avocado melt on sourdough which was made to perfection, and we shared the coconut cake. It was the best cake I've ever had, and I really hope y'all continue to put cake slices in the bakery case. Our coffee was delicious and fresh, and the service was also great! We love Sunflour.
Ended up leaving with a refund after 25 minutes of waiting for 2 breakfast sandwiches. Good food but inefficient service. We went back to give them another chance and were disappointed again.

Horrible non existent customer service and poor selection of everything.  I was ignored at the counter after waiting a few minutes I left to go to another bakery.  I will be patronizing that bakery from now on. Guess they are so successful customers aren't needed.
Really yummy pastries and good service. They were super busy though so if you come in the mornings expect a wait.
Great Chai latte and amazing pastries!! My photo..(bite missing) this was a savory ham, spinach and cheese.
Awesome pastries but get there early!

I had a sandwich mixup the other day and the customer service Sunflour took to remedy the mixup was so impressive. In addition to their delicious food, their service and care for their customers makes me wanting to keep coming back. Thank you Sunflour!

Really enjoyed this bakery! I'm always on the hunt for "the best" almond croissant when I travel and while this one wasn't "it", it was a really solid pastry. I also got a gluten free carrot muffin and really enjoyed that. The rest of the group got breakfast sandwiches and coffee, plus a cinnamon roll - all of which they were really pleased with!

It was busy when we went and it's a small interior space, so if you want a table for more than 2-3 people you'll want to go early. There's also a good space for outdoor seating!
I tried some muffins here today. Quality I would say was 7/10. However, the prices here are high. 1 muffin will cost you over $4 with tax. Their sandwiches are expensive too.

Upset with this location because I walked in and waited 30 minutes for a breakfast sandwich. Bad part is that the sandwich waited for 25 of them minutes and I introduced myself and they knew I was waiting on it. Doesn't make the food that bad but of course my sandwich was cold. I like the other locations

Really good food, I order from here on doordash at least 2 times a week because my girlfriend and I work from home. BUT  95% of the time they are out of something and dont let me know. Every time I try to order an almond croissant or a chocolate croissant they have none. I ordered both this morning at 9 am and when the food got here they were both replaced with regular croissants. No one notified me that they would be switched. The first couple of times I was like ok I get it but now it's just ridiculous; you would think that if you run out of something every day you would make more of it.
Nice spot very comfy
Nice and healthy sandwich for lunch
Delicious croissant, good coffee  and excellent service.
Had really good coffee and cookies
Very happy love the staff very friendly and helpful. Food is fantastic!
Highly recommended   Classy, good food, good service and excellent music.  Crowd was high energy and having fun!
ALWAYS BUSY because they're yummy and have a great neighborhood feel. Nice people and delicious drinks and snacks.

Amazing food and bakery!  The BEST sourdough bread I have ever had!!  And I have been eating fresh baked Amish sourdough bread since I was a kid.  The crust on this thing is perfect.  I bought seven loafs...  Sandwiches are awesome too!

Where should I start...
There is a styling issue with the espresso in this area. Me as a European it's annoying to have sour espressos in every coffee shop, that is the result if the water goes through the beans too soon. I asked the lady, she said they serve "sweet" espresso... it was sour.
If you want a great chocolate croissant, go to optimist hall, this won't be the place for that either.
The sandwich (#5) was really dry that, personally I would get in contact with a local sauce maker and on side add/promote sweet/mild/hot sauces with my food. That's a win-win.
Why 3 stars? -even if the products are not excelent, the place is okay. I like the style and the feeling when you step in.
Great breakfast and a most coffee spot!
Wonderful
I really like this cafe . It was a popular spot during my college days for a relaxing coffee and cake. Really recommend to all
Great little place! Perfect for a weekend breakfast

Coffee/vanilla latte is good. Service is unbelievably slow. 30 min for two sandwiches and coffee. And the staff is shockingly rude and snippy. Food was decent, but the experience left such a bad taste in our mouths.  I would not recommend this place/location. Maybe the other locations are better but def try to avoid this one unless you have plenty of time!

This was my first time actually going, I've ordered on Uber Eats a couple times but wanted to try dining in. I'm glad my boyfriend and I went. Although the dressing area is small it's charming and love being able to see the desserts and muffins up close. The oreo pumpkin cheesecake is scrumptious and so was my TAB on cheddar biscuit. My boyfriend got the club on Rosemary bread which unfortunately was not pressed very well because it did fall apart, he still thought it was good though!
4 out of 5 food items I ordered weren't delivered/refunded. The one item that was fulfilled was dry and overcooked
Not a fan. Cake was too sweet and very floury. My grilled cheese was terrible. This place lacks good, quality food while trying to be fancy
Great experience overall

I was visiting Charlotte for the first time and wanted to grab a cup of coffee and a nice pastry.  There were at least 3 people on staff, but the way they handled a long line was the main reason I gave it this rating.

Customer Service: I've worked in the coffee service industry for 3.5 years and I've never seen such a poor way to handle Customer connection and retention. no eye contact, no friendly tones, and barely any acknowledgment. An example of this is not asking to warm up pastries.

Expediting: There was one staff member literally standing around waiting for someone to just make an order while others stood in line. You could minimize waiting times by expediting orders and shifting priorities based on who needs support. This is common sense folks...

Overall experience:
The outside seating is a nice touch. But the flimsy wood chairs and tables take away from the experience.
Great vegan options!
Great pastries!!!
Food and coffee are great. Atmosphere is loud and seating is limited/not the most comfortable.

I had the pleasure of Elma taking care of me this morning. All of the employees there are great workers, but she was the one that took care of me. I had mistakenly spilled my drink all over the floor. I felt so embarrassed, but Elma assured me that she will remake my drink quickly and efficiently. My soon to be bad day turned into a great day. Will be back soon!!!

Stopped in with my daughter while shopping in the area and we needed lunch. I love the Turkey Bacon and Avocado sandwich. My daughter loved the muffins. Adorable little spot with great service and cute atmosphere. Definitely plan to return in the future.
So good. The cheddar scone is delicious.
Great place for breakfast/lunch. Everything is fresh and coffee is great.

Overhyped and underwhelming. I wanted to like Sunflour Baking, I really did, but after numerous sub-sub-sub par experiences I've given them their last chance. Service at the Dilworth location is consistently slow and the young staff they have in the front of house give off an apathetic vibe. This has clearly been reflected in the quality and timeliness of every experience I've had there. On one a occasion, we placed a pickup order which took an additional 40 minutes to receive past the initial 25 minute wait time we were given on the website. Over an hour for 2 breakfast sandwiches?! Every time we'd go to the counter to check on the status of the order we were told just a couple more minutes - meanwhile our coffees were ready but NOT given to us, only to get cold while they sat on the counter for nearly an hour. Another time I came shortly after opening when there was no wait but it still took nearly 30 minutes for a single breakfast sandwich to come out correctly (an incorrect order was given to me after about 12-15 minutes) and when I got home with it the bread seemed stale and inedible. I don't mind waiting for a quality, made-to-order product, but all of our orders here have left something to be desired and certainly have not been worth the painful wait times and meh service.

Ordered a couple of breakfast sandwiches on Sunday, and understandably they lost my order (which makes sense for a busy day). What doesn't make sense is that they constantly lied about my order being made, and after an hour admitted that they lost my ticket. I asked for a refund, which they said would be done at the end of the day, and would contact me saying so. That never happened, so I emailed the restaurant the next day asking for my refund. That was 2 weeks ago with no response by anyone at Sunflower. Now I'm going through my credit card company to dispute the charge since Sunflower haven't taken up the responsibility in getting me my refund. This is absolutely horrible management if this is the response one gets for reasonably asking for a refund for not getting their order!
Morning glory muffin is great, and outdoor seating is nice. Very little road noise.
Nice place !! Yummy

Ordered online for pickup and was told to wait for my order to be completed, waited approximately an hour. Then was told they didn't had the item in stock and my order was going to be cancelled. They didn't even reimburse for the cash they just gave a voucher/gift card.

East Blvd location, please do better about making enough gluten muffin and scones in the morning. This is my 3rd visit , less than three hours of you being open, and being told that all breakfast gluten option have been sold out. Obviously more inventory needs to be made to meet the demand so they do not sell out so quickly. It's disappointing to make the trip here just to have to leave.
Delicious cheesy biscuits of happiness and the best English muffins ever to exist!!

Went here for breakfast. I ended up getting one of their breakfast sandwiches which was decent but also nothing exciting about it. They did have a wide variety of breads for sandwiches as well as lots of yummy looking pastries.

I have been going to Sunflour since it first opened over off 7th Street. When they moved to my neighborhood several years ago, I was thrilled. Have been a steady customer for years BUT in the past 2 years there has been a steady decline. The front of house are often rude and unhelpful and the wait time for sandwiches is RIDICULOUS.  When I order online and go to pick it up at the time it says it will be ready, it never is. One employee today was so rude when I asked why my order wasn't ready, that she simply ignored me. They will no longer get my business

I placed an online order and paid for it ahead of time. However, when I arrived to pick up my order 2 of the pastries I paid for well ahead of time were not available. Why have people place orders ahead of time if you aren't going to place the items aside at the time the order was placed. I hate this because I love this bakery but I was buying them for someone who was having a bad day. All I ask is that when someone pays ahead of time for items, place them aside for the order. They have been paid for and should be available!
Absolutely love this place.  Would love to see some sugar free options in coffee syrups and baked goods.

Very good food, but unfortunately incredibly slow and disorganized... For that reason I will not be back unless I hear things have improved. Waiting 30+ minutes for a breakfast biscuit during non peak hours is not worth it.
Excellent as always. Their cheddar muffins are wonderful...just chewy enough  to be delicious and without being overly cheddary.  The coffee is also far better than Starbucks.

Accidentally spilled my drink right after it had been handed to me and I was mortified, but the ladies working there were so gracious and helpful and offered to make me a new one! Thank y'all so much, you saved my Sunday!  I will definitely be back

I love this place, they have fantastic sandwiches and desserts. Only reason for four stars is because they are ALWAYS out of the vegan chocolate chip cookie - why put it on the menu if it's never in stock?
Sandwiches and bakery items are good. The front of the house staff are friendly. But ticket times are awful. Every time we go, it takes about 25 minutes to get 2 sandwiches out.

I want to start off by saying I've been a fan of this place for awhile, but recently I've been very disappointed by the inconsistency. When I lived in south end I would come here legit every morning and get their coffee. For the past 6 months or so, however, I literally never know how my order is going to come out. If you order vanilla syrup in your drink, expect to taste none of it, because I'm pretty sure they either forget or put like one drop and that's it (even though it costs extra). They also give me the wrong size half the time. If you order any modifications on your food, it's doubtful they will accommodate those modifications. It's just disappointing because I used to come here all the time but I have to ask for like an extra cup full of vanilla syrup because you can't taste it. I think the workers just need more training on how to properly prepare coffee drinks
Love this spot. Their vegan and gluten free options are amazing. Plenty of coffee options as well as sandwiches.
I placed an online order, only to find out when I arrived, there were no cupcakes. And I was nor notified there were no cupcakes. Really?

3/2021 I kept driving by this place and seeing it packed with people so I figured I better give it a try.  I orded a Chai Tea and a pastry.  The Chai Tea wasn't to my liking but the pastry was out of this world delicious!! Just look at the picture below!!!  My fat little self wanted two of them but I was good and only had one!!   I would recommend stopping here to try out the pastries and coffee.
This is a great location with very friendly staff. This was my first visit; the cupcakes were cold, stale, and the icing was too hard and tasted old!
Delicious blueberry muffins.
They made my wife a gluten-free key lime cheesecake and it was delicious.
The store is incredibly inviting! The food and coffee were so-so, but i seemed to come during a busy time. I am definitely willing to give this place another try.
My first time ordering from this place with uber eats.  Prepare order took almost 2 hours and by the time I get delivery coffee so cold. Very annoying experience.

Oh Sunflour. It pains me to write this, but you let me down. You really have to figure out a better way to handle app orders on the weekends. We had to wait 15 minutes past the time the app said the food was ready. Not to mention, constantly following up at the counter. When we finally got the food, one sandwich was cold and one was hot. We went specifically to try the new pretzel bread. Paid extra for it, but ended up with sourdough. Womp.

Previous review: FIVE STARS
Love the breakfast sandwiches here. Make sure you sign up for the rewards program!
Great little bakery in south end. Try the bacon egg and cheese on a cheddar biscuit!
33 min for a chicken salad sandwich. No apology for the wait either. Thanks

We really like the food and treats at Sunflour but their online ordering is not very efficient. Both times I have ordered items in the bakery counter that are listed on the online menu they were not available. I received a call the first time to cancel or sub out the item but they just automatically cancelled it today. (I have 3 kids and coming home with 2 items doesn't make for family peace!)  Also, the online order does not always translate to the item you pick up - I ordered a grilled cheese sandwich and received a pimento cheese instead. (I thought I may have messed it up but double checked the online receipt and it was correct.) I was already home when realizing it and my daughter was thankfully flexible on eating a different sandwich than ordered.

I usually enjoy coming to the east Blvd location. Ordered a coffee and she proceeds to check out 15 more people behind me rather than getting my food and coffee ready. I can't figure out why they never have enough staff. How is someone supposed to make coffee, heat a muffin and check out. Also the girl working The counter showed no interest in her job. At least say have a great day or respond after someone says thank you

Food is great, but service is very mediocre. If you have a pickup order, staff ignore you (even in the designated pickup area) and you will have to join the line to get them to give you your order, negating the point of having a pickup area. The staff seems disorganized at best and uncaring at worst.

This happened twice in visits a month apart so it doesn't appear to be a random occurrence. I'd eat here more often if the service was better.

I was underwhelmed. My daughter and I stopped in yesterday for something sweet and a little decadent. I ordered the zucchini brownie and a sweet potato/peanut butter cookie that was not described well after asking twice what it was but I love sweet potato and peanut butter so figured it couldn't be bad. My daughter had the croissant and a hot chocolate. The brownie had potential but my scratch made flourless brownies taste better from home. The cookie had things in it that made me not finish (again it was not described well from the beginning), the taste was okay but I do not have to have either again. My daughter is a hot chocolate connoisseur and she disclosed it was not great. BUT the croissant was good...but you can get a good croissant most anywhere.

The service was even less thrilling than what we ordered. The two girls working weren't rude per se but sometimes great service makes you overlook the places where there is lack. The bites and the hot chocolate were better than the service. Maybe they were having a bad day but I did not feel any hospitality or level of friendliness that I expect from a neighborhood bakery...maybe it's because we don't live in that neighborhood ...I don't know but I don't have to ever return. Glad so many folks love it. I guess it's a matter of taste and "taste".  I would like to give them a try for a sandwich and perhaps they can redeem themselves with the flavor part...I will order online to keep my interaction with staff to a minimum to avoid another underwhelming customer service experience.

I have traveled the world and love local spots with good food and good service. Didn't get that here.

The best! I absolutely love visiting my family in Charlotte and never miss a chance to stop by Sunflour while I'm in town. Everything is delicious and made with great care and quality. Their cheddar biscuits are my very favorite but the scones, muffins, cookies, and sandwiches are also incredible. Great hospitality as well- I look forward to returning again and again and very highly recommend!
Best made-from-scratch croissants ever!!! My number one go to place for bakeries
Wonderful

Beautiful place and service! There is a great selection of gluten free and vegan pastries that are delicious. As well as great sandwiches and drinks.

100% recommended!

I live two hours away and drove here specifically to get the cinnamon rolls because I heard how good they were. I was not disappointed. These are better than Cinnabon. Not only was a staff friendly and accommodating but the quality is amazing.
Great pastries and cupcakes!
We all have choices in life and im glad I chose  Sunflower Baking Company..I got an iced dirty chai latte, cinnamon roll and BEC on a cheddar biscuit...It was soooo good. I definitely will be back!
The TAB is one of the best sandwiches I've ever had!

I rarely leave reviews even when I know I should, but my husband and I love this place so much we had to write one. I think the Sunny's Special (on a croissant) is the best breakfast sandwich in all of Charlotte. My husband loves the TAB (turkey avocado bacon) (also on a croissant). The cheddar biscuits and muffins we have tried are also delicious. Hands down one of our favorite breakfast and/or lunch spots in Charlotte. Can't say enough good things about it!

Giving an additional star bc the food is good. But looking to get breakfast to go in under 30 minutes? Look elsewhere. Slooooooow service. And they were fully staffed. No line when I came in, out the door w/people leaving 30 minutes later. Frustrating.

Food is good, but two complaints:
1) I had to wait for 20 minutes standing while they kept picking tons of phone orders and forgot about ours and others who ordered in person.
2) I saw a person without mask crossing to other side of the counter and checking the orders to find theirs. The person from the store came, chatted with them and make no comment over the lack of mask despite the signs asking costumers not to do that.
Best pastries and baked goods in the area, with Java juice that will get you going!

Food is always good, but I am disappointed that they are not following their own posted COVID guidelines. I called ahead for my order and had to stand in line to wait while it was already finished, which would have been fine. However, instead of their posted maximum occupancy of 12, there were many more people inside (probably double occupancy).
pricey for a coffee place. Very nice location though, great spot to sit outside and enjoy the weather. The coffee is great!

I eat here pretty regularly.  Always call in my order and allow at least 5 extra minutes because my food is NEVER ready.  Today, I was told 15 minutes so I gave it 20 and still had to wait 15 minutes when I got there.  For an avocado sandwich.  They were nice to offer me a pastry, but I'd rather they get my food prepared timely.  I keep coming back because the food is good, but they should be better with the time estimates, or hire more kitchen help.  Otherwise I'd give them 5 stars!

Arrived just after closing. The owner could tell I was not aware of new Covid hours, so he asked what I would like. I told him cinnamon buns and he gave me two on the house. These aren't any regular cinnamon buns either. They're monsters! Amazing food and service.

This was my second visit. To be a small, intimate place, I haven't found the staff to be very warm. However, the baked goods I've tasted are delicious. The muffin I pictured is called the morning glory and it is yum yum! The croissants are HUGE! The signage could be a bit larger in the cases. I will return!

This was a great spot for breakfast sandwiches. I had an egg and cheese croissant..my husband had a bacon, egg and cheese croissant. Fresh made. Enjoyed my hot chocolate. Cinnamon roll & cupcake which we took for the road. Great place..expect a line for wait. But worth it.
No complaints. Gets busy at times but has always been worth the wait.
Any of their breakfast sandwiches on a croissant turn any bad morning into a good one. Enjoy sitting outside and people watching, the pup was also very interested in my sandwich (avocado melt).
Cale was very good

Baked goods are tasty, however the service was very disorganized. It took close to an hour to get a couple pastries and some coffees. When I finally got everything, the cold brew coffee was vile. It tasted wildly over-extracted. Definitely won't be going back

Their iced peach blossom tea is actually the best tea I've ever had. Their pastries are extremely delicious, as well as their breakfast sandwiches. The staff is very friendly and besides a few accidental crumbs here and there on the tables, I would say the store is quite clean.
Hubby loves the vegan chocolate chip cookies!
1st time and the last time... this place blows.
Fantastic food, great coffee and a welcoming atmosphere make this my favorite place to spend a Saturday morning in Charlotte

While we were visiting Charlotte my wife chose this bakery. It fulfills her sweet tooth and my appetite for savory. I was skeptic but found a sandwich that I wanted, The Club she had the cheddar biscuit with egg, ham and cheese, then we had ordered a cinnamon roll.
I have to say the club I ordered was filled with turkey and ham, almost so much it was hard for me to take a bite. The sandwich was amazing, I enjoyed and finished feeling very satisfied. My wife's cheddar biscuit with egg, ham and cheese was great too. Too full to try the cinnamon roll at that very moment. We drove back to Charleston, SC so I waited until we got home to try the cinnamon roll and to my dismay I was disappointed... disappointed that now I have to drive 3 hours to get the awesome cinnamon roll!!!
I had lunch here, and the sandwiches were delicious. The pastries were amazing, specially the banana chocolate chip muffin! The service was fast and very kind. I would definitely come back.
Avocado Panini is so good! Great dirty chai latte too. Friendly service and cute sidewalk dining.
2 sandwiches took an hour to make. Not worth it. Wouldn't go back here.

The Bad: We'll cut to the chase here. The East Blvd location is NOT practicing social distancing. I went yesterday (Sunday) morning as a treat for my boyfriend's birthday. It was around 9 AM. Objectively and most likely the busiest time for the bakery, I'll give them that, but when we drove into the parking lot we saw a line almost out of the door and people waiting around inside. I told my boyfriend we could order online instead and just go in briefly to pick up the order, to avoid as much contact as we could. We made the order at 9:28, and the online service said it would be ready at 9:48, so we sat in the car for a while. At 9:50, I headed inside by myself to pick everything up. First, the online order pickup table is to the right of the main counter, which is also the direction that the line snakes around, meaning I would have had to be within 6 feet of at least 5 people just to get my order. I asked the cashier if she could snag it for me, and she went over to grab it. (The front of house staff were great throughout this experience, and this review is not a reflection on them.) I had ordered two breakfast sandwiches, two iced drinks and a croissant. Everything was ready but the breakfast sandwiches; there seemed to be some confusion between two front of house staff members about where the sandwiches were. It took an extra 30 minutes for the sandwiches to be ready.

Look, I get it. It's a busy Sunday morning, and you're wide open. Normally I'm a patient person. But my whole point of ordering online was to avoid standing in your store, where there are no markings on the floor to keep people spaced or a capacity sign on the front door. The line looked like any normal slammed pre-COVID bakery on a Sunday morning. People were not spaced out. And there I was stuck waiting for 30 extra minutes in that environment, constantly trying to move position to have the most amount of people away from me and HIGHLY uncomfortable the whole time. By the time I got the sandwiches my iced drinks were watered down and I was ready to write this review, but I did want to hold off as I hadn't tried the food yet. We got home (5 minute drive) and realized the sandwiches themselves were lukewarm as well. This only further added to irritation-- if the sandwiches had been done for a while, why did I sit in there for 30 minutes? Between the in-the-car waiting period and in the bakery itself, it took almost an hour for my online order to be done. If it was going to take that long, I would have rather waited at home and quickly picked up instead of putting myself in a potentially dangerous exposure situation.

In short-- guys, this virus is scary. Regardless of your views, it is real and terrifying to some people. It was an abstract concept at the beginning and is becoming more real as people I know post about contracting the virus themselves, and as the Carolinas reach insane peaks. We try to be careful while still supporting local, because we know it's tough and we want you to make it through this, but at least hold up to the option of staying safe if you're going to provide online ordering. I won't be coming back until the worst of COVID-19 is over, and I'm really sad to say that.

The Good: That being said, the food was delicious. Again, I'm a big Amelie's fan, but Sunflour just does it....better. You won't find as many options as far as actual sweets go, because Sunflour is a bakery first and foremost, but they've got it figured out. The breakfast sandwiches were HUGE. I had a bacon, egg, and cheese on a croissant and my boyfriend had the mozz tomato and spinach on a cheese biscuit. I was so jealous of that cheese biscuit, but the croissant was crazy buttery and flakey. The drinks didn't necessarily thrill us, but I suspect it was because they were pretty watery by the time we got to enjoy them. I got a chocolate croissant to go for the next morning's breakfast, and I can't say enough good things about it as well.

I'm sorry, Sunflour. But do better, for the people who love to support you and for Charlotte as a whole.
Always great food and service. A tad on the expensive side, but I still go back when I want a nice breakfast sandwich.

This is such a cute place, and the staff was very friendly. I got a cafe au pair and a pastry with raspberry and hazelnut chocolate spread in the middle. All the food was excellent, and I bet I'll be back tomorrow.
Love their vegan and gluten free options! The carrot muffin is a favorite
One word Yummy.Everytime l take my mother to the doctor all away across town.l go early to stop at this place.A coffee,3 cinnamon rolls,3 biscuits . Love it,friendly staff.
#1 small bakery in the city

Came here for coffee and pastries. We got an almond croissant, different cupcakes, and coffee. I was bummed they were all out of oat milk. The almond croissant was pretty good but lacked on filling - it was sparse and all on one side of the croissant. The cupcakes were great - even the a couple days later they were very moist.

Edit: was surprised with some pastries from here again in April 2020. Disappointment. The almond and chocolate croissants had a teeny bit of filling. It felt like a quarter sized dollop of filling. The croissant itself was pretty good and flaky, but if I'd wanted a plain croissant, that's what I would've gotten. The blueberry cream cheese danish was good though!
I had a great experience! Delicious oat milk latte :)
Excellent service and staff

I just ordered a vegan cake for my husbands birthday and it is amazing! I was nervous, I had never tried the vegan cupcakes/cake only had the chocolate chip cookies (which are so good!). I am so happy I decided to order, will definitely use for future cakes.
Really great cheddar biscuits and coffee
Delicious!
I sent my daughter in for a panini and it took over 30 minutes for her to come back. Got the ham and gruyere and certainly not worth 7.95.
Great vegan options !
Awesome Scones!  Just the right blend of dry on the outside and soft on the inside!

The food was really good! Recommend the Avocado Melt Panini. The cheddar biscuit was also good. I recommend that you get it warmed up. I had a vanilla latte and it was spot on. Not too sweet. Great place for breakfast, lunch, or brunch!
Great gluten free selection.
Good coffee
It was the perfect after dinner dessert! Was significantly cheaper than expected given the quality of the baked goods. We'll definitely be back for more sweets.
Good cheddar biscuit.
Jack, the owner, is very helpful and responsive. I visit here often for baked goods, coffee, a lite breakfast, etc.
Not up to usual standards.  Cinnamon roll seems stale, hard.  Still tasted good but not what I expect from this place.  Also, kept having to ask for multiple missing items from our check
Always excellent baked goods and breakfast sandwiches.
Amazing cheddar biscuit with egg. Key lime pie was awesome. Brownie was a little to cold/slightly frozen so didn't feel as fresh
Great friendly group of people. And they have Vegan food. Sometimes I'll buy a few of everything, you know, us vegans are afraid we'll never see them again.
Their food is good, but expensive. I visited on a busy morning and both items in my to-go order were missing ingredients. Check your order before leaving for complete satisfaction.
This place is amazing but I always find hair in my food
Great bakery on East Blvd, the cinnamon roll was amazing! Always seems busy and popular
Vegan options were surprisingly inadequate. Expected a lot more and was very disappointed.
I really enjoyed their double chocolate sea salt covered cookies. Ended up getting their 3 for $5 offer because they're that good!
Sunflour baking is an amazing place to get great coffee, pastries, baked good, and what might possibly the best peanut butter and jelly I have ever had the privilege of eating.
Great cafe

I go here a lot and I enjoy their GF scones and muffins and occasional cupcake. I wish they had GF bread as the sandwich options look delicious. There really isn't a great GF lunch item other than a salad which is good but small.

The coffee cake I bought for a brunch got great reviews.

I'd go 5 stars but the service can be iffy. And they are out of chai tea more often than they have it. The chai doesn't bother me as much as the service, which can be SLOW and sometimes, unfriendly :/
Super cozy, great service, good coffee and delicious pastry. Great for a chill and nice time. Great location too!

Sunflour Baking many thanks for your generous donation of vegan food and desserts at Freedom Fest 2019! I attended the event over the weekend and sampled one of your mini chocolate cupcakes...absolutely yummy!! These mini cupcakes are the perfect little taste of chocolate- just enough to satisfy a chocolate craving. And, the frosting...delish!! Thank you again for supporting this event with your delicious food and desserts!!

Oh boy! The cheedar biscuits with anything are amazing! Local roasted coffee, make a great latte or cold brew. Our boys love the muffins, banana chocolate chip is the fan favorite, would have pictured it but was destroyed before I could get my phone out.

Wow way to kill it with the online reviews here.  Good for you people keeping them above a four point five star rating.  This is a place that has a lot of charm to it when you drive by.  It is located in the very quaint and bustling Dilworth area.

It was my first ever visit here. After waiting on the group at the counter in front of me, the 2 staff girls walked away and couldn't be bothered to say good morning or ask if I wanted anything. I got the attention of one of them and gave her my order. She rang me up and put my order in a bag.
If you are going to handle the money, use gloves for the food, even if you are trying to be careful and only touch the paper, there's just no way, yuck.  I wanted to buy one of the cakes since it was only $35, now way, not with such poor customer service.

What can I say, you can never go wrong with a club sandwich. But this one was absolutely delicious on Rosemary bread. Not a fan of tomatoes and red onions so I took those off but that did not take away from the flavor at all. Oh and my provolone cheese is going in two different directions, because the cheese pull was epic! It took all of 10 minutes for my order to be ready, the atmosphere was very cozy and the staff was awesome.
Delicious breakfast and coffee. The blueberry Nutella Danish was amazing as were the breakfast sandwiches on cheddar biscuits.

My favorite morning sandwich spot in Charlotte. I get the egg salad sandwich on a croissant, and I get their chia seed pudding every chance I get. Nice, friendly, attentive service. So glad this place is around.

Plus they have gluten free, dairy free, and other healthy options that you can choose from. Great spot to meet up with friends, co-workers, clients over a light and quick breakfast.
amazing pastry options, solid coffee, lots of nice seating options and natural light and a perfectly chill playlist
Great breakfast or snack place. Good coffee and lot of yummy stuff to eat. Highly recommend stopping by if driving by. Friend staff too.
Omg, I could gain so much weight if I lived closer to this place! Yummy everything! LovingLight11(dot)com
The spinach, tomato & Priceline breakfast sandwich is my favorite, but anything on their croissants is great! Fast, friendly service too!

I come for the egg salad on a croissant. It's probably the best egg salad recipe I've had. It's my piece of heaven during my lunch break. One of the few places in South End that has parking. There's nothing like taking a break from a hectic day to grab lunch, coffee, and a sweet treat then sit to enjoy it in a naturally lit room because of their floor to ceiling windows and to people watch or car watch with people in it, lol.
Cupcakes are really good. Staff was really friendly. Wheelchair entrance is hidden in the back. Doorways are barely accessible with 1-2 inch lips.
